results.title: Australian Notebook. No. 2
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine contains historical items of Victorian history including: Country fire fighters in annual event at Chelsea; Veteran cars in rally - Melbourne/Brighton time trial; Ancient petrol rail car service in Melbourne suburb, Vic Rail introduce new suburban train - Blue Train; St Kilda-Brighton Electric tramway celebrates 50 years service.

results.title: Australian lizards
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the five families of lizards found in Australia: goannas, dragons, skinks, geckoes and legless lizards. Illustrates the differences in size, shape, colour and pattern. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Australian is a wide word
results.brief_description: Perhaps the most pertinent issue of this video is why some or many of us have difficulties defining the term “Australian”, particularly in describing ourselves. The title is the response of one person in the video to this issue.

results.title: Australian identity. Yrs 7-10
results.brief_description: A program presented in ten segments on the Australian identity. 1. What’s an identity? 2. What’s an Australian? 3. Popular legends. 4. Aboriginal identity. 5. People left out of our legends. 6. Defiance of authority. 7. The Anzac legend. 8. White colonial Australia. 9. Legends about women. 10. Changing national identity. Uses extracts from early Australian feature films and stills to focus on the question of who are Australians.

results.title: Australian history

results.brief_description: A film by cartoonist Bruce Petty using graphics and animation to present a satirical view of Australian history from early settlement to the present.

results.title: Australian gold rushes. - Years 7-10.
results.brief_description: Provides a general overview of the Australian gold rush period 1850-1900. It is presented in three segments: 1. “Discoveries”. - 2. “Gold rushes 1800-1900”. - 3. “Mining methods”. Consists of re-enactments, segments from early Australian feature films and stills from the period. This video would also be suitable for younger students.

results.title: Australian football: fitness, skill, sportsmanship
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, John Kingsford-Smith, Bruce Andrew, Jack Hamilton and Fulton Muir
results.brief_description: Depicts important points of play in Australian Football and the need for fitness and training; excerpts from the 1969 Victorian Grand Final and the Interstate Football Carnival in Adelaide in 1969. Commentary by Brian Naylor.

results.title: Australian football
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films, Australian Football Council and Bruce Andrew
results.brief_description: This film explains and demonstrates the following Australian rules terms: drop kick, punt kick, stab kick, place kick, highmarking, chest marking, hand ball, turning and baulking, tackling, ruck play, shepherding and blocking. Commentary by Eric Welch.
